review_title: Be prepared to work verrryyyy hard
job_title: Emergency Department Technician in Rolla, MO
pros: Overtime pay is very nice, though rare when the team is fully staffed.
cons: They will run you ragged. Burnout is very common in this role and the turnover rate is very high.

job_title: HIM EPIC Analyst in Rolla, MO
pros: Benefits are ok but lacking. Other than that not much to offer. If you want to work in a high school environment, then working here has much to offer.
cons: No vision no growth unless you are in the cheerleader clique. The management has run the team into the ground.  Leadership does not have any relevant IT experience.  The CEO is totally aware of the toxic Management.   Total divisiveness created between the  IT teams. Now they can't figure out why no one trusts them. Head stuck in the cloud like it is the Mayo Clinic.  No engagement with the staff, just a fake front. Funny, Forbes list Phelps as a top place to work in Missouri but the results of the actual employee surveys show less that 28% think it is a good place to work.  IT is even lower.  How does that happen?  A management goal was to improve employee satisfaction by a couple %. Very sad that mid year the survey results were so bad that they made managers remove this as a goal as it appears it was not achievable, ie see above, and not making goals means no increases. So, you can imagine management didn't what this as a goal for the department and affect them, but the funny thing is the toxic management caused the current situation.  All employees have been recently sent the annual employee survey.   The IT department surveys will unanimously  show a no confidence vote from which the current leadership will not recover.  There has been confusion in the past of which level of management was being referenced in employee answers.  The CEO just needs to read the comments this time to see where the problem lies.  FYI, no one was allowed to see survey comments from the last annual employee survey as they were so bad.  You aren't given respect......you earn it.

pros: Love the people I work with. Great company culture.
cons: Because they are a not-for-profit the pay is lower than industry standard.

job_title: Central Supply Technician in Rolla, MO

They will harbor a personal grudge and then lie to have you fired. Human Resources was a joke until I played audio recordings. When I first voiced my concerns to management they specifically said to not take the matter to HR.

review_title: It wasn't too hard, but wasn't that enjoyable
pros:
The patients are wonderful and so are some of the other staff
My job instilled a strong ethic to clean and keep things clean
Pay was fair and upped with city inflation
Supervisors of my department were extremely fair if you had an emergency or sickness and worked with you about hours
I personally had a very extensive training process and overtime is given for orientation
Uniform was hardly strict at all; red shirt and black yoga pants would be fine in a stretch, daily if you had to.
Retirement plan included with job; all benefits optional, even for lowest tier workers.
cons:
Gossip! Terrible! Gossip!
I never really felt valued as an employee, nor did I ever get thanked or congratulated on either a job well done or teaching myself
Sometimes a job presented itself that I was not trained nor prepared for, and I was expected to deal with it
The people who trained me told me they had had very little to no training themselves and received assignments that nurses had to help them to accomplish.
Standing and walking for hours upon hours- have really nice shoes. And be sure they're broken in.
Supervisors were often unavailable and went home early.
